timeline.bodyText: This constructor is currently public because this class lives in a different package than the convenience layer.
timeline.author: azabbasi

replies.bodyText: A user should never need to initialize this type, correct?
replies.author: abhipsaMisra

replies.bodyText: correct, I am talking to Srikanta to see what we should do here.
replies.author: azabbasi

replies.bodyText:
Spoke to @azabbasi offline and discussed 3 options.

Leave the public ctor as-is since this is output-only model and the user is not expected to create a new instance
Use an interface for public model type and define a concrete type in implementation package
Use a helper type to convert from internal type to public type and make the ctor package-private on the public type.

For options 1 and 3, flatten the internal ModelData type and pass the properties directly.
replies.author: srnagar

replies.bodyText: Thank you Srikanta. I went with the 3rd option as it seems to be the cleanest
replies.author: azabbasi

timeline.bodyText: this gives us correctly formatted json string, correct?
timeline.author: abhipsaMisra

replies.bodyText: no, I had to use writeValueAsString to get that out of the object.
replies.author: azabbasi

timeline.bodyText: I don't think we need java doc comments on these private fields, the getters and setters have the comments already, so this feels repetitive. What do you think?
timeline.author: abhipsaMisra

replies.bodyText: This is a copy of the ModelData, I tried to keep changes as minimal as possible.
replies.author: azabbasi

timeline.bodyText: Will this be included retrieving multiple models also?
timeline.author: bikamani

replies.bodyText: yes, it's only used for the list operation and it is turned on by default in .NET, so I turned it on by default in here too.
replies.author: azabbasi

replies.bodyText: Isn't this false by default, on the .NET client?
replies.author: abhipsaMisra

replies.bodyText:
Correction:
On GetModel we use default value of true and do not have an overload to change it. So this constant will not change.
On ListModel, default value is false.
replies.author: azabbasi

timeline.message: Use converter approach to construct Models

timeline.bodyText: We call this ModelData in the .NET client, maybe call it the same here as well?
timeline.author: abhipsaMisra

replies.bodyText: sure, we can reuse the same name now that they are in 2 different packages.
replies.author: azabbasi

timeline.bodyText: Should we thrown an exception here? An exception here indicates that service sent us incorrectly formatted data, we should surface this exception up.
timeline.author: abhipsaMisra

timeline.bodyText: Why not have the converter take in the PL ModelData directly?
timeline.author: abhipsaMisra

replies.bodyText: good question, we cannot expose any models from the implementation package to the user. and now that we are hiding the ModelData, we can't take it as a parameter here since this is in the core.model package
replies.author: azabbasi

timeline.author: abhipsaMisra

timeline.bodyText: nit: tabbing needs to be fixed
timeline.author: abhipsaMisra

timeline.bodyText: method reference here as well -> anywhere we are calling a static method can be replaced by a method reference
timeline.author: abhipsaMisra

timeline.bodyText: these comments need to be updated -> DigitalTwinModelData
timeline.author: abhipsaMisra
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -66,7 +66,7 @@
      * definition.
      *
      * @param displayName the displayName value to set.
-     * @return the ModelData object itself.
+     * @return the DigitalTwinModelData object itself.
